intro: Sesamum indicum, commonly known as sesame, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its erect stem, alternate leaves, and distinctive capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, oval-shaped seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters and thrives in warm, dry climates. Sesame seeds are rich in oil and are widely used in culinary and industrial applications. Its botanical features make it a valuable crop for both agriculture and traditional medicine.
